meanings.definition: A flat-bottomed iron with a detachable handle used for pressing clothes.
meanings.sent1: My grandmother's old sadiron was heavy but effective at removing wrinkles from clothes.
meanings.sent2: I used the sadiron to press my shirt before the job interview.
meanings.sent3: The sadiron and I had a race to see who could smooth out the shirt faster.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a sadiron, ironing out all the obstacles in her path.
meanings.sent5: The sadiron glided over the fabric, leaving it crisp and neat.

meanings.definition: To press clothes with a sadiron.
meanings.sent1: I carefully sadironed my dress for the party.
meanings.sent2: She sadirons her husband's shirts every Sunday evening.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to play with the sadiron as I pressed my pants.
meanings.sent4: His words sadironed her heart, leaving it flat and lifeless.
meanings.sent5: The chef sadirons the uniform before each cooking demonstration.

meanings.definition: The act of using a sadiron to remove wrinkles from clothing.
meanings.sent1: The quick sadiron of the shirt made it look brand new.
meanings.sent2: She learned the art of sadironing from her mother.
meanings.sent3: The sadironing contest at the fair drew a large crowd.
meanings.sent4: His swift movements with the sadiron were like a dance on the fabric.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the sadiron hissing on the fabric was oddly satisfying.
